result.execSummary:
The defendant Marco A Lezameta Uribe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Huber with standard release conditions.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes:
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.

No VIOLENT contact with: victim/witness listed in the criminal compliant.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations. Collection may include income assignment
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s. No Use or Possession of alcohol.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. Court waives domestic abuse surcharge.

Confidential Crime Victim(s) Information.

10:46 AM Defendant Marco A Lezameta Uribe in court.  Attorney Timothy T. Kay in court for Marco A Lezameta Uribe.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with the defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Count 2. 

Court orders the following:
60 DAYS  Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.
Consecutive to any other sentence
STAYED for PROBATION
Term of Probation: 2 YEARS

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
 Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
 No Use or Possession of alcohol, 
 Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
 No VIOLENT contact with:  victim/witness listed in the criminal compliant 
 DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

D/V SURCHARGE: WAIVED BY THE COURT
COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Witness C listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Witness A/Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

09:11 AM Defendant Marco A Lezameta Uribe in court with attorney Timothy T. Kay.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Attorney Kay states he was Court appointed to cases 21CM2144 and 22CM659.  Defendant is sworn in and testifies as to his current financial situation.  The Court will extend Attorney Timothy Kay's appointment to this matter.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
